definition: cat-like gait/sashaying gait of a catwalk model
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu

sentences.english: She has begun a modeling course, and can not walk the cat walk well.
sentences.chinese: 剛剛開始學習模特課程，她的貓步還走不好呢。

sentences.english: The beauty pageant contestant having their catwalk training at Dazzle Concepts, the modelling company.
sentences.chinese: 選美賽的參賽者在摸特兒訓練公司進行貓步訓練。

sentences.english: When models work the catwalk, they act as if the audience isn't there.
sentences.chinese: 當模特們在走貓步時，他們會當做觀衆不存在。

sentences.english: She's quite used to treading the catwalk.
sentences.chinese: 她已經習慣了在走貓步。

definition: swaggering/staggering/waddling
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
pole dancing
seductive appearance/fawning manner
surfboard/paddleboard
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
(literary) to smile
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to travel around the country
running as fast as flying
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
sparkling with wit (idiom)
to have no cares/to be carefree
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
sullen/to scowl miserably
